FuncDef:
The nat log tcp start-port command sets the start port number for a NAT device to use TCP to send user logs to a log host.
The undo nat log tcp start-port command deletes the start port number for a NAT device to use TCP to send user logs to a log host.
By default, no start port number is set for a NAT device to use TCP to send user logs to a log host.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the start port number for a NAT device to use TCP to send user logs to a log host.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 65026.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The NAT log host is configured using the nat log host command supports logs in UDP mode. To reliably transmit user logs without loss, configure a NAT device to send users logs in TCP format to a NAT log host.
To establish a TCP connection between a NAT device and a log host, run the nat log tcp start-port command to set the start port number used in the TCP connection.
Follow-up Procedure
The nat log tcp host command configures a NAT log host to receive user syslogs in TCP format. With this command run, a NAT device sends user syslog logs in TCP format to the log host.
Precautions
You must plan the start port number and check whether the start port number to be specified is used. The start port number must be not in use.
The nat log tcp start-port command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E.
